01-01.event: Bitcoin surpassed $1,000 for the first time since 2013.

01-02.event: Ripple (XRP) reached an all-time high of over $3.

01-03.event: Bitcoin's Genesis Block was mined, marking the launch of the network.

01-04.event: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization reached $700 billion.

01-05.event: Ethereum Classic suffered a 51% attack, leading to double spending.

01-06.event: Bitcoin surpassed $35,000, setting a new all-time high.

01-07.event: The Kraken cryptocurrency exchange was launched.

01-08.event: CoinMarketCap excluded South Korean exchanges from price calculations, causing a market drop.

01-09.event: Telegram agreed to delay the launch of the TON blockchain due to SEC lawsuits.

01-10.event: Dash cryptocurrency (formerly known as XCoin) was launched.

01-11.event: Bitcoin dropped below $13,000 following news of potential crypto bans in South Korea.

01-12.event: Ethereum conducted a hard fork to fix a protocol vulnerability.

01-13.event: Bitstamp resumed operations after a hack that resulted in the theft of 19,000 BTC.

01-14.event: Ethereum hit a new high, surpassing $1,200.

01-15.event: Konstantin Ignatov, co-founder of OneCoin, pleaded guilty to fraud.

01-16.event: Bitcoin dropped below $10,000 for the first time since November 2017.

01-17.event: The cryptocurrency Nxt, one of the first Proof-of-Stake coins, was launched.

01-18.event: BitConnect announced the closure of its platform, causing its token to collapse.

01-19.event: Bitcoin fell by 20% after reaching an all-time high.

01-20.event: Coinbase received a license to operate in New York.

01-21.event: Coincheck was hacked, resulting in the theft of $530 million in NEM tokens.

01-22.event: Bitcoin surpassed $9,000 amid rising tensions in the Middle East.

01-23.event: AuroraCoin, a cryptocurrency designed for Iceland, was launched.

01-24.event: Facebook banned cryptocurrency and ICO advertisements on its platform.

01-25.event: Russia proposed a bill to regulate cryptocurrencies.

01-26.event: Elon Musk added #Bitcoin to his Twitter bio, causing BTC's price to surge.

01-27.event: Mt. Gox halted withdrawals citing technical issues.

01-28.event: Telegram raised $850 million in the first round of its ICO for the TON project.

01-29.event: Binance launched its decentralized exchange, Binance DEX.

01-30.event: Bitcoin surpassed $10,000 for the first time since October 2019.

01-31.event: India announced plans to ban the use of cryptocurrencies for payments.

02-01.event: Facebook banned cryptocurrency and ICO advertisements on its platform.

02-02.event: Mt. Gox, once the largest Bitcoin exchange, halted all withdrawals citing technical issues.

02-03.event: Tesla announced a $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin, leading to a significant price surge.

02-04.event: China intensified its crackdown on cryptocurrency trading, targeting online platforms and mobile apps.

02-05.event: The U.S. SEC announced the formation of the Cryptocurrency Enforcement Division.

02-06.event: The U.S. Senate held a hearing on cryptocurrencies, discussing potential regulations.

02-07.event: Bitcoin exchange Bitstamp suspended withdrawals due to a DDoS attack.

02-08.event: Mastercard announced plans to support select cryptocurrencies directly on its network.

02-09.event: The SEC and CFTC held a joint hearing on the future of cryptocurrency regulation.

02-10.event: Japan's Mt. Gox exchange filed for bankruptcy after losing 850,000 bitcoins.

02-11.event: Bitcoin reached a new all-time high, surpassing $48,000.

02-12.event: South Korea implemented new regulations requiring real-name accounts for cryptocurrency trading.

02-13.event: The IRS announced that it would treat cryptocurrencies as property for tax purposes.

02-14.event: Ethereum reached a new all-time high, surpassing $1,800.

02-15.event: The European Central Bank warned about the risks of investing in cryptocurrencies.

02-16.event: The first Bitcoin ATM in the U.S. was installed in Austin, Texas.

02-17.event: Binance Coin (BNB) entered the top three cryptocurrencies by market capitalization.

02-18.event: The SEC charged BitFunder and its founder with operating an unregistered securities exchange.

02-19.event: The University of Nicosia in Cyprus announced it would accept Bitcoin for tuition payments.

02-20.event: Bitcoin surpassed $50,000 for the first time.

02-21.event: Japan's Financial Services Agency issued warnings to several cryptocurrency exchanges.

02-22.event: The Bitcoin Foundation announced plans to establish a self-regulatory organization for the industry.

02-23.event: Square announced a $170 million investment in Bitcoin.

02-24.event: The G20 announced plans to discuss cryptocurrency regulations at its upcoming summit.

02-25.event: The IRS issued guidance on the tax treatment of virtual currencies.

02-26.event: MicroStrategy announced the purchase of an additional $1 billion in Bitcoin.

02-27.event: The SEC issued subpoenas to numerous cryptocurrency firms as part of a broader investigation.

02-28.event: The U.S. Marshals Service auctioned off 30,000 bitcoins seized from Silk Road.

02-29.event: Bitcoin's leap year price surge: BTC saw a significant increase, reaching $8,600.

03-01.event: Bitcoin surpassed $60,000, leading to technical issues on Coinbase due to high demand.

03-02.event: Ethereum's Berlin hard fork was successfully implemented, improving gas efficiency.

03-03.event: Cardano launched its Mary hard fork, introducing native tokens and multi-asset support.

03-04.event: Bitcoin's price dropped below $9,000 amid global market uncertainties.

03-05.event: Binance launched its decentralized exchange (DEX) on the testnet.

03-06.event: The SEC issued a statement requiring cryptocurrency exchanges to register with the agency.

03-07.event: Bitcoin's market capitalization surpassed $20 billion for the first time.

03-08.event: The DAO, a decentralized autonomous organization, was launched on the Ethereum blockchain.

03-09.event: Bitstamp resumed full operations after a security breach earlier in the year.

03-10.event: Mt. Gox filed for bankruptcy protection in the U.S. following its collapse.

03-11.event: Gnosis implemented a mainnet hard fork to enhance network security.

03-12.event: The U.S. released Consumer Price Index data, impacting cryptocurrency markets.

03-13.event: A major Bitcoin network upgrade was activated, improving transaction efficiency.

03-14.event: Bitcoin reached parity with the U.S. dollar, trading at $1 per BTC.

03-15.event: The first Bitcoin halving occurred, reducing the block reward from 50 to 25 BTC.

03-16.event: Bitcoin.org was registered, marking the establishment of Bitcoin's online presence.

03-17.event: The first Bitcoin transaction was made between Satoshi Nakamoto and Hal Finney.

03-18.event: Litecoin underwent a halving event, reducing its block reward to 12.5 LTC.

03-19.event: Google announced a ban on cryptocurrency-related advertisements.

03-20.event: The SEC rejected the Winklevoss twins' proposal for a Bitcoin ETF.

03-21.event: Ethereum's Homestead upgrade was successfully implemented.

03-22.event: Ripple Labs was fined $700,000 by FinCEN for violating AML regulations.

03-23.event: The IRS declared that virtual currencies would be taxed as property.

03-24.event: Bitcoin's price reached $100 for the first time.

03-25.event: The Bitcoin Foundation was established to promote Bitcoin development.

03-26.event: The first Bitcoin exchange, BitcoinMarket.com, was launched.

03-27.event: The first Bitcoin block, known as the Genesis Block, was mined.

03-28.event: Ethereum's Constantinople upgrade was successfully activated.

03-29.event: Japan's FSA issued warnings to several cryptocurrency exchanges.

03-30.event: Bitcoin's market cap surpassed $20 billion for the first time.

03-31.event: The DAO, a decentralized autonomous organization, was launched on Ethereum.

04-01.event: Bitcoin's market capitalization surpassed $100 billion for the first time.

04-02.event: Ethereum's Constantinople hard fork was successfully implemented.

04-03.event: Ripple announced a partnership with a major financial institution to enhance cross-border payments.

04-04.event: Binance launched its NFT marketplace, expanding into the digital art space.

04-05.event: Cardano's Alonzo upgrade introduced smart contract functionality to the network.

04-06.event: Solana experienced a network outage due to a surge in transaction volume.

04-07.event: Litecoin's Lightning Network went live, enabling faster transactions.

04-08.event: EOS launched its mainnet, transitioning from the Ethereum blockchain.

04-09.event: Tron acquired a major decentralized application to expand its ecosystem.

04-10.event: Chainlink integrated with multiple DeFi platforms to provide reliable oracles.

04-12.event: Avalanche announced a major upgrade to improve scalability and security.

04-13.event: Monero implemented a hard fork to enhance privacy features.

04-14.event: Stellar burned a significant portion of its supply to increase token value.

04-15.event: Tezos launched a major protocol upgrade to improve governance.

04-16.event: Cosmos enabled inter-blockchain communication, connecting multiple chains.

04-17.event: Algorand partnered with a national government to develop a digital currency.

04-18.event: VeChain launched a major supply chain solution for a global retailer.

04-19.event: Dash introduced InstantSend, allowing for near-instant transactions.

04-20.event: Zcash implemented Sapling upgrade to enhance transaction efficiency.

04-21.event: IOTA resumed network operations after a major security breach.

04-22.event: NEO announced plans for N3, a major network upgrade.

04-23.event: Theta launched its mainnet 3.0, introducing new staking features.

04-24.event: Filecoin partnered with a major cloud provider to expand storage solutions.

04-25.event: Qtum integrated with Amazon Web Services to offer blockchain solutions.

04-26.event: Ontology launched its mainnet, providing a high-performance public blockchain.

04-27.event: Waves introduced a decentralized exchange to enhance liquidity.

04-28.event: Hedera Hashgraph partnered with a major telecom company to develop DApps.

04-29.event: Elrond launched Maiar Exchange, a decentralized trading platform.

04-30.event: Harmony announced a $300 million ecosystem fund to support developers.

05-24.event: Qtum integrated with Amazon Web Services to offer blockchain solutions.

06-01.event: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele announced plans to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender, making it the first country to do so.

06-02.event: The U.S. Department of Justice charged the CEO of Mining Capital Coin with operating a fraudulent $62 million crypto scheme.

06-03.event: The Federal Trade Commission reported that approximately 46,000 investors lost over $1 billion in cryptocurrency scams from January 2021 through March 2022.

06-04.event: Bitcoin's price dropped below $20,000 for the first time since 2020, fueling extreme fear in the market.

06-05.event: El Salvador's President announced plans to make Bitcoin legal tender, a world first.

06-06.event: Reuters reported that Binance facilitated $2.35 billion in money laundering between 2017 and 2021.

06-07.event: The U.S. Justice Department recovered $2.3 million worth of Bitcoin paid by Colonial Pipeline in a ransomware attack.

06-08.event: El Salvador's Legislative Assembly voted to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender alongside the U.S. dollar.

06-09.event: El Salvador officially became the first country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender.

06-10.event: Bitcoin's price fell below $20,000 amid market downturns and regulatory concerns.

06-11.event: Bitcoin's price reached $0.08, marking a significant early milestone.

06-12.event: The SEC concluded its investigation into Ethereum and Consensys without filing charges.

06-13.event: BTC Prague, a major Bitcoin-focused conference, was held in Prague, Czech Republic.

06-14.event: Bitcoin's price dipped below $60,000, influenced by the anticipated distribution of Mt. Gox bitcoins.

06-15.event: Investment giant BlackRock filed an application for a Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF), aiming to offer the first spot Bitcoin ETF in the U.S.

06-16.event: Bitcoin's price continued to decline, reaching new lows amid market volatility.

06-17.event: The Federal Reserve announced interest rate hikes, impacting cryptocurrency markets.

06-18.event: Bitcoin's market capitalization fell below $1 trillion due to ongoing market downturns.

06-19.event: Major cryptocurrency exchanges experienced outages amid high trading volumes.

06-20.event: Bitcoin's price showed signs of recovery after weeks of decline.

06-21.event: Valkyrie filed an S-1 registration form for a Bitcoin spot ETF with the SEC.

06-22.event: The SEC filed charges against a former Coinbase employee in an insider trading case.

06-23.event: Bitcoin's price stabilized around $20,000 after recent fluctuations.

06-24.event: The G7 discussed cryptocurrency regulations amid growing concerns.

06-25.event: Bitcoin's hash rate reached a new all-time high, indicating strong network security.

06-26.event: Major financial institutions announced plans to offer cryptocurrency services.

06-27.event: Bitcoin's price experienced a brief surge amid positive market sentiment.

06-28.event: The European Union proposed new regulations for digital assets.

06-29.event: Coinbase shared blockchain technology with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

06-30.event: The U.S. Justice Department filed securities fraud charges against leaders of a $100 million cryptocurrency exchange Ponzi scheme.

07-01.event: Bitcoin's price reached $55,000 amid growing institutional interest.

07-02.event: Ethereum's London hard fork was successfully implemented, introducing EIP-1559.

07-03.event: Solana experienced a network outage due to a surge in transaction volume.

07-04.event: Binance faced regulatory scrutiny from multiple countries, impacting its operations.

07-05.event: DeFi platform Compound surpassed $1 billion in total value locked.

07-06.event: Bitcoin's hash rate reached an all-time high, indicating increased network security.

07-07.event: The SEC rejected the Winklevoss twins' proposal for a Bitcoin ETF.

07-08.event: Ethereum's market capitalization surpassed $20 billion for the first time.

07-09.event: Bitcoin's second halving occurred, reducing the block reward from 25 to 12.5 BTC.

07-10.event: Litecoin's market capitalization exceeded $1 billion amid increased adoption.

07-11.event: Ripple partnered with a major financial institution to enhance cross-border payments.

07-12.event: Bitcoin's price reached $100 for the first time, marking a significant milestone.

07-13.event: The first Bitcoin halving occurred, reducing the block reward from 50 to 25 BTC.

07-14.event: Bitcoin.org was registered, marking the establishment of Bitcoin's online presence.

07-15.event: Bitcoin surged to a two-week high after an assassination attempt on U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump, who is regarded as a champion of cryptocurrency.

07-16.event: Ethereum's market capitalization surpassed $200 billion for the first time.

07-17.event: Bitcoin's price dropped below $30,000 amid market volatility.

07-18.event: India-based cryptocurrency exchange WazirX was hacked, leading to the loss of approximately $234.9 million in investor funds.

07-19.event: The European Union proposed new regulations for digital assets.

07-20.event: Ethereum split into two blockchains following The DAO hack, resulting in Ethereum and Ethereum Classic.

07-21.event: Bitcoin's price surpassed $10,000, signaling a bullish trend.

07-22.event: Facebook announced plans for its cryptocurrency project, Libra.

07-23.event: The SEC delayed its decision on a Bitcoin ETF proposal, causing market uncertainty.

07-24.event: Bitcoin's market capitalization exceeded $50 billion for the first time.

07-25.event: Bitcoin's price reached $700 amid increased adoption.

07-26.event: Ethereum's Frontier network was launched, marking the beginning of its blockchain.

07-27.event: Donald Trump delivered a keynote speech at the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville, Tennessee, pledging to make the U.S. the leading nation in cryptocurrency and Bitcoin.

07-28.event: Bitcoin's price reached $600 amid growing interest from investors.

07-29.event: The first hardware wallet prototype, Trezor (previously Piglet), was introduced.

07-30.event: Ethereum's mainnet was launched, introducing smart contracts to the blockchain ecosystem.

07-31.event: Bitcoin's price reached $0.08, marking a significant early milestone.

08-01.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) approved the first Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF), allowing investors to gain exposure to Bitcoin without directly owning the cryptocurrency.

08-02.event: Nomad bridge experienced a security breach, resulting in the loss of nearly $200 million in cryptocurrencies.

08-03.event: Ilya Lichtenstein admitted to committing the 2016 Bitfinex hack, one of the largest cryptocurrency thefts in history.

08-04.event: Heather R. Morgan pleaded guilty to money laundering charges related to the 2016 Bitfinex hack.

08-05.event: Ethereum implemented the London hard fork, introducing EIP-1559 to change its fee structure.

08-06.event: Solana suffered a major outage due to a surge in transaction volume, causing network instability.

08-07.event: The U.S. Department of Justice announced the recovery of $315,000 from the 2016 Bitfinex hack.

08-08.event: The U.S. Treasury sanctioned Tornado Cash, a cryptocurrency mixer, for its role in laundering illicit funds.

08-09.event: Coinbase launched its own Layer 2 solution, Base, to improve scalability and reduce transaction costs.

08-10.event: The U.S. Federal Reserve released guidelines for banks to engage with cryptocurrency firms.

08-11.event: Bitcoin's price surpassed $50,000 amid growing institutional adoption.

08-12.event: The U.S. Congress introduced a bipartisan bill to regulate stablecoins and digital assets.

08-13.event: Ethereum's market capitalization exceeded $500 billion for the first time.

08-14.event: The European Union proposed new regulations to combat cryptocurrency-related money laundering.

08-15.event: Phantom Wallet users experienced a temporary glitch causing funds to appear missing, which was later identified as a visualization error and swiftly resolved.

08-16.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission delayed its decision on several Bitcoin ETF applications.

08-17.event: The U.S. Department of Justice charged a former Coinbase employee with insider trading.

08-18.event: Bitcoin's hash rate reached a new all-time high, indicating increased network security.

08-19.event: ZachXBT, an online investigator, uncovered a $243 million Bitcoin theft, leading to the arrest of suspects Malone Lam and Jeandiel Serrano.

08-21.event: The U.S. Federal Reserve announced plans to develop its own digital currency.

08-22.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charged a decentralized exchange with operating an unregistered securities platform.

08-23.event: Bitcoin's market dominance reached 50% for the first time in over two years.

08-25.event: Ethereum's transition to proof-of-stake reached 80% completion, moving closer to the Merge.

11-01.event: The cryptocurrency market experienced a surge in trading volumes, reaching levels not seen since May 2021.

11-02.event: Celestia (TIA) unlocked nearly 1 million tokens, valued at approximately $4.76 million, distributing them to early investors and core contributors.

11-03.event: Bitcoin's price approached its all-time high, driven by increased institutional adoption and favorable market conditions.

11-04.event: The Crypto Assets Conference (CAC) commenced in Frankfurt, Germany, focusing on digital assets, blockchain technologies, and financial innovations.

11-05.event: Project Galaxy (GAL) unlocked 7.61 million tokens, representing approximately 16.36% of the total supply, as part of its vesting schedule.

11-06.event: The CAC conference concluded, highlighting key developments in asset tokenization, decentralized finance (DeFi), and regulatory frameworks.

11-07.event: Bitcoin's market capitalization surpassed $1.5 trillion, reflecting growing confidence among investors.

11-08.event: Binance Blockchain Week began in Istanbul, Turkey, exploring how blockchain and cryptocurrencies can enhance the lives of a billion people worldwide.

11-10.event: Binance Blockchain Week concluded, emphasizing the importance of innovation and regulation in the crypto space.

11-28.event: The U.S. Department of Justice announced the arrest of individuals involved in a $100 million cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme.

11-29.event: Bitcoin's price surpassed $70,000, setting a new all-time high.

11-30.event: Optimism (OP) unlocked approximately 31.34 million tokens, valued at $53 million, as part of its token release schedule.

12-01.event: Bitcoin's price reached a new 2023 high, surpassing $38,600, reflecting an 11% increase over the past month.

12-02.event: The cryptocurrency market faced increased scrutiny from regulators worldwide, leading to discussions on stricter regulations.

12-03.event: Major financial institutions announced plans to integrate blockchain technology into their operations.

12-04.event: The European Union proposed new regulations to combat cryptocurrency-related money laundering.

12-05.event: Bitcoin's hash rate reached a new all-time high, indicating increased network security.

12-06.event: Dogecoin was officially launched, starting as a 'joke' cryptocurrency and later gaining widespread popularity.

12-07.event: The U.S. Department of Justice announced the seizure of $2.3 million in cryptocurrency paid to ransomware attackers.

12-08.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission approved the first Ethereum futures ETF.

12-09.event: Bitcoin's market dominance reached 50% for the first time in over two years.

12-10.event: The U.S. Treasury Department issued guidelines for banks to engage with cryptocurrency firms.

12-11.event: Bitcoin's price reached $60,000 amid growing institutional interest.

12-12.event: The U.S. Congress introduced a bipartisan bill to regulate stablecoins and digital assets.

12-13.event: The U.S. Department of Justice charged a former Coinbase employee with insider trading.

12-14.event: The U.S. Federal Reserve announced plans to develop its own digital currency.

12-15.event: The U.S. Treasury sanctioned a cryptocurrency mixer for its role in laundering illicit funds.

12-16.event: Bitcoin's price surpassed $50,000 amid growing institutional adoption.

12-17.event: The U.S. Federal Reserve released guidelines for banks to engage with cryptocurrency firms.

12-18.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission delayed its decision on several Bitcoin ETF applications.

12-19.event: PayPal announced that U.S. merchants can now buy, hold, and sell cryptocurrency from their business accounts.

12-20.event: Bitcoin's price stabilized around $50,000 after recent fluctuations.

12-21.event: Changpeng Zhao, founder of Binance, was released from prison after serving a four-month sentence for money laundering violations.

12-22.event: The U.S. Department of Justice announced the arrest of individuals involved in a $100 million cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme.

12-23.event: Bitcoin's price surpassed $70,000, setting a new all-time high.

12-24.event: The U.S. Congress held hearings on the environmental impact of cryptocurrency mining.

12-25.event: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission approved a new Bitcoin futures ETF, expanding investment options for institutional investors.

12-26.event: Bitcoin's price closed the year at an all-time high, reflecting a year of significant growth and adoption.

12-27.event: The cryptocurrency market experienced increased volatility amid global economic uncertainties.

12-28.event: The European Union proposed new regulations to combat cryptocurrency-related money laundering.

12-29.event: Major financial institutions announced plans to offer cryptocurrency services.

12-30.event: Bitcoin's hash rate reached a new all-time high, indicating increased network security.

12-31.event: The U.S. Department of Justice announced the seizure of $2.3 million in cryptocurrency paid to ransomware attackers.
